metadata.case_name: Ranganathan Chettiar v. AL. PR. AL. Periakaruppan Chettiar
metadata.case_number: Civil Appeals Nos. 104 of 1954 and 169 of 1956

facts.text: Periakaruppan Chettiar owned considerable properties and adopted AL. PR. Alagappa Chettiar (Alagappa) in or about 1914.
Acute differences arose between Periakaruppan and Alagappa from about 1924 due to Alagappa's wasteful habits and debts, leading to criminal complaints in 1926 (Exs. P-5 and D-12).

One of Alagappa's creditors attached Alagappa's half share in the family residential house; litigation found site ancestral but superstructure built by Periakaruppan from self-acquired funds (High Court judgment November 19, 1926, reported in Periakarappan Arunachalam).
During pendency of house litigation, Periakaruppan purported to adopt second son AL. PR. Ranganathan Chettiar (Ranganatha) on June 27, 1926, claiming Nattukottai Chetti custom.

Alagappa and his minor son AL. PR. AL. Periakaruppan Chettiar (junior Periakaruppa), represented by mother Muthayi Achi, filed O.S. No. 114 of 1926 on September 9, 1926, for half share of properties as joint family and declaration second adoption invalid.

Suit O.S. 114/1926 compromised by Rajinama on August 15, 1927: Alagappa got Rs.75,000 (two hundis Rs.25,000 and Rs.50,000), junior Periakaruppa Rs.75,000 hundi, Muthayi Achi Rs.14,000 stridhan; all properties admitted self-acquisitions of Periakaruppan, no rights for plaintiffs, vacate family house, withdraw Privy Council appeal; certified for minors' benefit.

Rajinama terms: Rs.75,000 for junior Periakaruppa and Rs.14,000 for Muthayi Achi to be invested in Chetti houses in name of junior Periakaruppa to order of Periakaruppan and A.P.S. Chockalingam Chettiar (Chockalingam, maternal uncle of Muthayi); signature letters/accounts with Chockalingam; Chockalingam to discharge Alagappa's debts from his Rs.75,000.

Periakaruppan executed will on April 4, 1929; genuine and duly executed; arranged charities, residue to wife Lakshmi Achi for life then to Ranganatha; Ranganatha in possession since Lakshmi's death March 11, 1930.
Periakaruppan died July 14, 1929; wife Lakshmi Achi died March 11, 1930.
Junior Periakaruppa attained majority December 1943; filed O.S. 156/1944 (trust suit) and O.S. 164/1944 (succession suit) on November 11, 1944.

In trust suit (O.S.156/1944): Claim Rs.75,000 under Rajinama constituted trust by Periakaruppan and Chockalingam; wrongly appropriated by Chockalingam; Periakaruppan jointly liable; Rs.30,000 invested in Athangudi house July 23, 1928, credited.

In succession suit (O.S.164/1944): Recover entire properties from Ranganatha; adoption invalid, will ineffective; devolves on Alagappa and junior Periakaruppa; not barred by limitation due to minority.
Hundi Rs.75,000 collected May 31, 1928, endorsed to Chockalingam's Rangoon firm; credited June 19, 1928 in name of junior Periakaruppa to order of Periakaruppan and Chockalingam.

Trial court (Subordinate Judge, Devakottai, Dec 21, 1946): Adoption invalid; will ineffective; devolution on joint family (Alagappa and junior), s.7 Limitation Act bars junior; trust suit decreed partly.

High Court (Madras): Adoption invalid; will ineffective; Rajinama caused division inter se Alagappa/junior; s.7 inapplicable; decree half share to junior in succession suit; trust suit decreed against Ranganatha half loss.
High Court judgments: A.S. No. 484/1947 (Nov 13, 1950), A.S. No. 243/1947 (Sep 17/Oct 24, 1952).

legal_issues.text: Whether adoption of Ranganatha valid (conceded invalid).
Whether Periakaruppan's will effective to vest title in Ranganatha as persona designata despite invalid adoption.
If will ineffective, whether properties devolved on Alagappa alone or both Alagappa and junior Periakaruppa; effect of Rajinama on status.
Whether junior Periakaruppa's suit barred by s.7 Limitation Act, 1908.
In trust suit: Whether Rajinama constituted Periakaruppan and Chockalingam joint trustees for Rs.75,000; breach of trust; liability on Periakaruppan's estate.

petitioner_arguments.text: Will effective; Ranganatha takes as persona designata.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Will construction; Nidhoomoni Debya v. Saroda Pershad Mookerjee; Fanindra Deb Raikat v. Rajeshwar Das

petitioner_arguments.text: Rajinama did not divide Alagappa and junior inter se; if will ineffective, devolution on Alagappa excluding junior.
Suit barred by s.7 Limitation Act.
No trust created under Rajinama; Periakaruppan not trustee; investments proper; subsequent transactions (house purchase, mortgage) ratified.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rajinama and hundi construction; Nattukottai Chetti usage (maral)

respondent_arguments.text: No effective dispositive clause in will; estate in tail-male invalid; disposition conditional on valid adoption.
Rajinama divided Alagappa and junior inter se; s.7 inapplicable.
Rajinama constituted Periakaruppan and Chockalingam joint trustees; invested in Chockalingam's firm contrary to terms; breach; Periakaruppan liable.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Negotiable Instruments Act ss.8,9,13,78; trust principles

court_reasoning.text: Will effective; Ranganatha takes residue as persona designata, not dependent on adoption validity; inspired by experience with Alagappa; excludes Alagappa/heirs explicitly.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Reference to 'adopted son' descriptive; testator conscious of adoption challenge; character over status emphasized.

court_reasoning.text: No need to decide division or limitation as will valid.
Rajinama and hundi: 'Order' and 'mel parthu' mean supervision, not control/ownership; no trusteeship on Periakaruppan; Chockalingam primary; contemporaneous acts show no involvement by Periakaruppan.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Deposit receipt not negotiable instrument; parties' conduct confirms no joint control by Periakaruppan.

holdings.text: Will validly disposes residue to Ranganatha as persona designata.
No trusteeship created making Periakaruppan liable for Rs.75,000.

precedents_cited.relevance: Prior litigation on family house superstructure as self-acquisition.

precedents_cited.case_name: Nidhoomoni Debya v. Saroda Pershad Mookerjee
precedents_cited.relevance: Distinction in will gifts to adopted person: dependent on valid adoption or persona designata.

precedents_cited.case_name: Fanindra Deb Raikat v. Rajeshwar Das
precedents_cited.relevance: Description vs. motive/condition in bequests; surrounding circumstances.
Meaning of 'maral' depends on usage proof.

precedents_cited.case_name: Krishnashet bin Ganshet Shetye v. Hari Valjibhatye
precedents_cited.relevance: Negotiable Instruments Act applies to hundis absent usage.

precedents_cited.case_name: In re Travancore National and Quilon Bank Ltd.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for appeals to Supreme Court.

statutes_cited.name: Limitation Act, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Bar on minor's suit if father de facto manager.

outcome.summary: Succession appeal (C.A. No. 169/1956) allowed; plaintiff's suit dismissed as will valid vesting title in Ranganatha. Trust appeal (C.A. No. 104/1954) under consideration with reasoning no trusteeship on Periakaruppan (text cuts off but implies favorable).

key_quotes.text: "All the immovable and movable properties entirely, which belong to me as my own and which are in my possession are my self-acquired properties. Excepting myself no other person has any interest or right whatever in the said properties."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Will's assertion of absolute self-acquisition, excluding others.

key_quotes.text: "Neither the aforesaid Alagappa nor his heirs shall have any manner of right or interest whatever in the properties which are now in my possession and in the properties which might be acquired hereafter."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explicit exclusion of Alagappa and heirs from succession.

key_quotes.text: The question is whether the gift... is one which is dependent on whether all the requisites of a valid adoption have been complied with or whether it is to a designated person notwithstanding that it was desired and expected that the requisites for a valid adoption were complied with.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Test for persona designata vs. conditional on adoption (citing precedent).
